SubTopics: Write text in a variety of modes.
Content: Both “Safe Slumber” and “Where Do Animals Sleep?” tell about ways that different animals sleep. Write an essay explaining why animals sleep in different ways. Use evidence from both passages to support your response in your essay.

:ibox:PLAN before you write
• Read the entire passage(s) carefully.
• Read the question carefully.
• Think about how the question relates to the passage(s).
• Organize your ideas on scratch paper. Use a thought map or outline to plan your essay.
• Plan to include multiple paragraphs in your essay.

FOCUS while you write
• Analyze and explain what you think about the information from the passage(s) in your essay.
• Support and develop the ideas in your essay by using text evidence from the passage(s).
• Use correct language, a variety of sentence types, and transitions between paragraphs in your essay.
• Organize your essay with an introduction, body, and conclusion.

SubTopics: Use resources to determine word meanings.
Content: Read the sentence.
:ibox:Janell, I am glad we are going to be on the same basketball team, Krista said with a smile.
Which revision correctly adds quotation marks to the sentence?

A.Choice: “Janell, I am glad we are going to be on the same basketball team, Krista said with a smile.”

B.Choice: “Janell, I am glad we are going to be on the same basketball team,” Krista said with a smile.

C.Choice: Janell, “I am glad we are going to be on the same basketball team”, Krista said with a smile.

D.Choice: Janell, “I am glad we are going to be on the same basketball team, Krista said with a smile”.

SubTopics: Convey events, real or imagined, through narrative or short stories to develop experiences or events using descriptive details and clear event sequences to establish a situation and introduce a narrator or characters. Use dialogue and description of actions, thoughts, and feelings to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations.
Content: A student is writing a report about the human body. Read the paragraph from the report.

:ibox:(1) The human body has over 200 bones. (2) Together, the bones of the body are known as the skeleton. (3) Bones give the body its shape. (4) They help to protect the organs inside the body. (5) ______________ , they allow for some types of movement.
Which word would BEST show how sentence 5 connects with sentences 3 and 4?

SubTopics: Recall information from experiences or gather information from print and digital sources; take brief notes on sources and sort evidence into provided categories.
Content: Read the paragraph from a student's research report about Sonja Henie.

:ibox:Sonja Henie was only 5 years old when she won her first ice-skating contest. She went to the Olympics when she was 11 but finished in last place. She kept working hard to improve her skills. In the next three Olympic Games—in 1928, 1932, and 1936—she was the skating champion. After she quit skating, she worked as an actress and as a businesswoman.
Which source would most likely give the student more information about the life of Sonja Henie?

B.Choice: a website about the history of the Olympics

C.Choice: a book called Learn How to Skate Like a Pro

D.Choice: a website for a nearby ice-skating rink

SubTopics: Determine main ideas and supporting details of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats.
Content: Which detail supports the idea that flamingo parents have a special bond with their chick?

A.Choice: They use mud to build a nest and keep the chick in it for a week.

B.Choice: They take the chick to meet the other chicks in the flock.

C.Choice: They recognize their chick's voice and come quickly if they hear it.

D.Choice: They take the chick to the flock to make sure it is safe from predators.

SubTopics: Ask and answer questions about information from a speaker, offering elaboration and detail.
Content: According to the presentation, which statement is true?

A.Choice: The only place to see a flamingo is at a zoo.

B.Choice: If flamingos ate different foods, they would not be pink.

C.Choice: Most of a flamingo's day is spent searching for food.

D.Choice: The reason why flamingos stay in large groups is because they cannot fly.

SubTopics: Determine the meaning of words, phrases, figurative language, and academic and content-specific words within a text.
Content: Read the sentence from the passage.
:ibox:Sadly, the chilly, wet weather had chased all the villagers inside.
What does the sentence mean?

A.Choice: The weather seemed to follow people.

B.Choice: People wanted to stay indoors because of the weather.

C.Choice: The weather caused people to run to a dry place.

D.Choice: People felt bothered by the type of weather outside.

SubTopics: Describe a character (traits, motivations, feelings) drawing on specific details from the text.
Content: How does the action of Pablo letting the dog into his shop add to the sequence of events?

A.Choice: It leads to good things happening to Pablo.

B.Choice: It allows Pablo to see that Leah is right.

C.Choice: It leads to a mess that Pablo cleans up.

D.Choice: It allows Pablo to teach friends how to work.

SubTopics: Summarize portions of a text to determine a theme or central idea and explain how it is supported by key details.
Content: This question has two parts. First, answer Part A. Then, answer Part B.
Which sentence BEST states the central message of the passage?

A.Choice: Kindness to others will be rewarded.

B.Choice: People do not always get what they want.

D.Choice: Animals can help make people happy.

Content: Which sentence from the passage BEST supports the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: They each stood in front of their stores, wishing for customers.

B.Choice: Then Pablo dried and brushed its fur.

C.Choice: At once, the dog barked with joy.

D.Choice: His shop had earned record sales.

Topics: Reading Information - Integration Of Knowledge & Ideas
SubTopics: Explain how claims in a text are supported by relevant reasons and evidence.
Content: Which sentence BEST describes the connection between paragraphs 2, 3, and 4 of the passage?

A.Choice: Paragraphs 2 and 3 describe a problem with bird nests and paragraph 4 tells how the problem is fixed.

B.Choice: Paragraphs 2 and 3 describe different bird nests and paragraph 4 tells how the nests protect the birds.

C.Choice: Paragraphs 2 and 3 describe the materials birds use to make nests and paragraph 4 tells the steps for how they build the nests.

D.Choice: Paragraphs 2 and 3 describe how different birds build nests and paragraph 4 tells how two types of birds use the nests made by other birds.

SubTopics: Develop and answer questions to locate relevant and specific details in a text to support an answer or inference.
Content: According to the passage, what is the purpose of the tunnels in the mounds of Australian termites? Choose TWO answers.

B.Choice: to help the inside of the mound stay cool

C.Choice: to store the eggs that the termites lay

D.Choice: to give the termites a place to grow food

E.Choice: to protect the termites from other insects

SubTopics: Discuss how the reader's point of view or perspective may differ from that of the author, narrator, or characters in a text.
Content: What is the author's purpose in this passage?

A.Choice: to explain how building makes animals different from people

B.Choice: to tell stories about creatures that like to build

C.Choice: to explain the different types of homes that creatures build

D.Choice: to compare how bird nests are different than what insects build
